intro: Gymnopentzia, commonly known as the naked pentagon, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Meliaceae. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The genus includes several species, most of which are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. Gymnopentzia plants typically grow as shrubs or small trees, and they often thrive in moist, shaded environments. Their botanical features make them of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
